channel.title: Digital Video Camera's
channel.description:
I know nothing about digital video camera's, but they really dropped in price so I want to buy one. Also, not to be confused with a digital camera.
Like I said, I know nothing. I want a [i]decent[/i] one, under 500 dollars(otherwise my parents wont get me one for christmas). is there a reccommended brandname I should buy? Also should I be getting a certain kind of memory card? If someone could just walk me through what I should know before getting one, that'd be great thanks.

item.title: Digital Video Camera's
item.dc:creator: @0wn4g3_r4ngr 0wn4g3 r4ngr
item.description:
@0wn4g3_r4ngr wrote:

Yea I’d get a kodiak, they’re not expensive and great resolution.

Read full topic

item.title: Digital Video Camera's
item.dc:creator: @Andrewsouls Andrewsouls
item.description:
@Andrewsouls wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:5, topic:28947”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=42642.msg525566#msg525566 date=1164513105]

Well i can help with the memory card.
They are called SD cards for… well i don’t know what it means…
They come in sizes just like USBs like 128mb 256mb 512mb 1gig, and the price goes up when you get bigger ones obviously… every photo that i take with the digital camera i own is about just under 2mb…
So depending on how many photos you want to take before you download them onto the computer, decide what size card… I myself got a 256mb card because the camera gets used on occasions like Christmas, but yeah pretty much just special occasions…

Hope this has helped you!

Like I said, I want a video recorder, not something to take pics. Do they make SD cards for a digital video camera?
[/quote]

Most digital video cameras use RW+/- dvds.[/quote]
Yeah some have hardrives inside them, but i don’t know how big…

Read full topic

item.title: Digital Video Camera's

item.description:

Well i can help with the memory card.
They are called SD cards for… well i don’t know what it means…
They come in sizes just like USBs like 128mb 256mb 512mb 1gig, and the price goes up when you get bigger ones obviously… every photo that i take with the digital camera i own is about just under 2mb…
So depending on how many photos you want to take before you download them onto the computer, decide what size card… I myself got a 256mb card because the camera gets used on occasions like Christmas, but yeah pretty much just special occasions…

Hope this has helped you!
[/quote]
Like I said, I want a video recorder, not something to take pics. Do they make SD cards for a digital video camera?[/quote]

Most digital video cameras use RW+/- dvds.

Read full topic
